name: GitHub Meetup in Fukuoka
body:
GitHub Meetup in Fukuoka =====
It was a great lesson! Thank you!
Review of lesson ---
#### Create an empty container! ``` $ mkdir fukuoka $ cd fukuoka/ $ git init Initialized empty Git repository in xxx/fukuoka/.git/ ```
#### Add new File! ``` $ vim RREADME.md $ git status # On branch master # # Initial commit # # Untracked files: # (use "git add ..." to include in what will be committed) # # RREADME.md nothing added to commit but untracked files present (use "git add" to track) $ git add RREADME.md $ git commit -m 'add readme' [master (root-commit) 0d1962b] add readme 1 file changed, 2 insertions(+) create mode 100644 RREADME.md ```
#### Change the file! ``` $ vim RREADME.md $ git add RREADME.md $ git commit -m 'make achange' [master b97dc0d] make achange 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+) ```
#### Push to GitHub! ``` $ git remote add origin git@github.com:itokami1123dev/fukuoka.git $ git push -u origin master Counting objects: 6, done. Delta compression using up to 4 threads. Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done. Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 444 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done. Total 6 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0) To git@github.com:itokami1123dev/fukuoka.git * [new branch] master -> master Branch master set up to track remote branch master from origin. ```
I do my best work! I became a fan of github!
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
